## Structure and Semi-structured

### JSON
- JavaScript Object Notation
- Lightweight, human-readable data format 
- Used for web APIs and configuration files.

```json
{
  "name": "Jane Doe",
  "age": 30,
  "isStudent": false,
  "courses": ["History", "Statistics"]
}
```

##
### XML
- Extensible Markup Language
- Structured text file that organizes data into a tree-like hierarchy of elements

```xml
  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
  <library>
      <book id="bk001">
          <title>The XML Handbook</title>
          <author>Charles F. Goldfarb</author>
          <genre>Computer</genre>
          <price>49.99</price>
      </book>
      <book id="bk002">
          <title>Learning XML</title>
          <author>Erik T. Ray</author>
          <genre>Programming</genre>
          <price>39.95</price>
      </book>
      <book id="bk003">
          <title>XML Developer's Guide</title>
          <author>Matthew Gambardella</author>
          <genre>Computer</genre>
          <price>44.95</price>
      </book>
  </library>
```

- PSV: Pipe Separated Files
- SSV: Semicolon Separated Files
- FWF: Fixed Width Format files

They are also saved as a *.csv file
